Appearance.Color: Blonde and golden to deep golden-copper
Appearance.Head: White to off-white, fizzy to creamy and delicate to generally lasting

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Generally bready and sweet, leaning biscuity in Kolsch and Blonde, to caramel in ESB
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Low to moderate aroma and flavor of Noble hop variety in Kolsch and any variety in Blonde, and earthy English hop character in ESB
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity esters generally low in Kolsch, moderate in Blonde and moderate to high in ESB

Mouth-feel.Consistency: Smooth, with a crispness to Kolsch and some Blondes

Kolsch.Popular_Examples: Gaffel Kolsch, Reissdorf Kolsch, Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale, Ballast Point Pale Ale, Harpoon Summer Beer, Alaskan Summer Ale, Pyramid Curve Ball Blonde Ale, Stoudts Karnival Kolsch, New Holland Full Circle
Kolsch.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Brick, Brie, Camembert, Edam, Monterey Jack
Kolsch.Food_Pairing_Ideas: German dishes, salads, chicken dishes, grilled foods, fish, shellfish and spicy foods

Extra_Special_Bitter.Popular_Examples: Fullers ESB, Redhook ESB, Left Hand Sawtooth Ale, Anderson Valley Boont ESB, AleSmith Anvil Ale ESB, Yards Extra Special Ale, Shipyard Ringwood Old Thumper, SKA ESB Special Ale, Southern Tier Harvest Ale, Laughing Dog CSB
Extra_Special_Bitter.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Asiago, Derby, Gouda, Havarti, Lancashire, Leicester
Extra_Special_Bitter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Fish and chips, pork, roast chicken, lamb, barbecue, fried foods and pizza

American_Blonde_Ale.Popular_Examples: Pike Brewing Naughty Nellie Golden Ale, Scuttlebutt Homeport Blonde, Diamond Knot Blonde Ale, Great Divide Samurai Ale, Knee Deep Beautiful Blonde, Red Brick Blonde, Moylans Celts Golden Ale, St George Golden Ale, Ska True Blonde Ale, Blue Point Summer Ale, Fish Tale Organic Blonde Ale
American_Blonde_Ale.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Brick, Edam, Monterey Jack, Pepper Jack
American_Blonde_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Italian dishes, salads, chicken dishes, grilled foods, fish, shellfish and spicy foods

Appearance.Color: Very Pale, from almost white, to brown
Appearance.Head: Fluffy, thick and long-lasting, leaving a lace on the glass

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Sweet and biscuity to chocolaty and toasty in dark versions
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity, with mild citrus to estery notes, including banana, with spicy flavor compounds, including clove in some styles

Weizenbock.Popular_Examples: Aventinus Wheat Doppel, Weihenstephaner Vitus, Schneider and Brooklyner Hopfen-Weisse, Ayinger Weizenbock, Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
Weizenbock.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Beef, roast pork, smoked ham, German-style dishes, desserts and chocolates

Witbier.Popular_Examples: Hoegaarden Original White Ale, St. Bernardus Witbier, Wittekerke, Allagash White Ale, Avery White Rascal, Ommegang Witte, Southampton Double White Ale, Unibroue Blanche de Chambly, Hitachino Nest White Ale, Clown Shoes Clementine White Ale

Witbier.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Edam, Feta, Goat Cheese Chevre, Mascarpone, Mozzarella
Witbier.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with light and vinaigrette dressings, light seafood dishes, mussels, sushi, lightly seasoned poultry and apple glazed pork

Hefeweizen.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with fruity or vinaigrette dressings, German-style dishes, apple glazed pork and light seafood

Dunkelweizen.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Sausages, German dishes, roast chicken and pork

Appearance.Color: Deep golden to amber to copper
Appearance.Head: Generally white, creamy and lasting

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Generally bready and sweet with caramel notes, and sometimes toasty
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Earthy hop character in English styles; citrusy, piney hop character in American styles
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity esters from the ale yeast strain

Mouth-feel.Consistency: Smooth and creamy, with American styles often crisp

Irish_Red_Ale.Popular_Examples: OHaras Irish Red, Smithwicks Irish Ale, Murphys Irish Red Beer, Samuel Adams Irish Red, Starr Hill Amber Ale, Karl Strauss Red Trolley Ale, Knee Deep Immigration Red Ale, Thomas Hooker Irish-Style Red Ale, Moylans Irish Style Red Ale, Thomas Creek River Falls Red Ale
Irish_Red_Ale.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Dubliner, Goat Cheese Chevre, St. Nectaire
Irish_Red_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Lamb, light fish dishes, French onion soup, roast beef and barbecue

Appearance.Color: Light amber to dark brown and virtually black
Appearance.Head: Full to minimal or none, depending on style and alcohol level, with higher ABV beers containing little to no head formation or retention

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Sweet caramel and toffee-like to dark roasty
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Generally mild to moderate in Old World styles up to strong aromas, flavors and bitterness in some American styles
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Esters provide balance and may be stronger in some styles/versions and add complexity

Mouth-feel.Finish: Generally long and often dry due to alcohol

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Range includes sweet, caramel, chocolaty, toffee, toasty, nutty, coffee, roasty and dark fruits
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Mild, although American examples may contain citrus character
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Generally neutral, though soft fruity esters may be present

English_Brown_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Beef stew, grilled and roasted meats, pork and sausage

Appearance.Head: Creamy, often long-lasting, leaving a lace on the glass

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Caramel-sweet, chocolaty, toffee, coffee, toasty, roasty or burnt
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Supportive bitterness in Irish and English styles; aromatic and bold in American styles
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Estery notes of various dark fruits, including plum and fig

Mouth-feel.Finish: Long to everlasting, dry to wet

Appearance.Head: Off-white to tan and generally lasting

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Include caramel, chocolaty, toffee, toasty, nutty, coffee, dark fruit and mild to assertive roasty character
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Generally mild, although some American examples can be more assertive
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Generally neutral, though moderate fruity esters may be present

Mouth-feel.Consistency: Smooth, while more roasty versions may have some astringency
Mouth-feel.Carbonation: Ranges across examples from delicate to spritzy

English_Porter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Roasted, smoked and barbecued foods, including beef, poultry, seafood, sausage, chili and hearty stews. Try with cheesecake for dessert

American_Porter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Roasted, smoked and barbecued foods, including beef, poultry, seafood, sausage, chili and hearty stews. Try with cheesecake for dessert

Black_and_Tan.Taste_Smell: Balanced, Roasty, Floral, Light- Medium- bodied
Black_and_Tan.Popular_Examples: Yuengling Black and Tan, Saranac Black and Tan, Mississippi Mud Black and Tan, Mendocino Black Eye Ale
Black_and_Tan.Glassware: Pint or nonic, tumbler, beer mug
Black_and_Tan.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: If the dark and light beers are separate in your glass, try Asiago, Colby, and Gloucester with the porter dark, and hang onto some Colby and try it along with Brick, Cheddar and Edam with the pale ale/lager half
Black_and_Tan.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Roasted and barbecued beef, chicken and seafood

Cream_Ale.Glassware: Pint or nonic, tumbler, beer mug

Fruit_Beer.Popular_Examples: Samuel Adams Cherry Wheat, Samuel Adams Blackberry Witbier, Abita Purple Haze, 21st Amendment Hell or High Watermelon Wheat Beer, Epic Brewing Brainless on Peaches, Laughing Dog Huckleberry Cream Ale, Leinenkugels Berry Weiss, Sea Dog Blue Paw Wheat Ale, Long Trail Blackbeary Wheat, Harpoon UFO Raspberry Hefeweizen, Lost Coast Tangerine Wheat, Samuel Smiths Organic Strawberry Fruit Beer
Fruit_Beer.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Soft mild cheeses, including Goat Cheese Chevre, Mozzarella

American_Wild_Ale.Popular_Examples: Allagash Interlude, Allagash Confluence, Jolly Pumpkin La Roja, Brewery Ommegang Aphrodite, Victory Wild Devil, Russian River Supplication, Russian River Consecration
American_Wild_Ale.Glassware: Stemmed tulip, large wine glass, flute
American_Wild_Ale.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: The base beer is often a determinant for cheese pairings. Choose from mild cheeses, such as Goat Cheese Chevre, that allow the beer to remain center-stage, to bold cheese varieties, such as Blue Cheese, that stand up to the beer. Experiment and find what works for your palate
American_Wild_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Suggestions from the above named beers respective brewery websites include seafood, charcuterie, sausages and smoked meats
